Posted By: persecutor (5/8/2011 12:00:43 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
He'll be great in my Glint Hawk deck. It has way more equipment than the usual cawblade deck.   
  
[Nim Deathmantle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nim Deathmantle) & [Livewire Lash](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Livewire Lash) should both be fantastic with this guy. Especially if you don't want to sink 100+ dollars into swords.  
  
Great standard impact or not, this guy will dominate kitchen tables for many many years to come.  
  
UPDATE:  
  
So the ruling on this guy ETB with Metalcraft on. Since you have priority, you can call the equip 0 as soon as he ETB before, and an opponent can respond with a [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade). However since you called the equip 0, it still resolves despite Puresteel or his metalcraft no longer existing.  
  
Meaning that this guy dropping in with 3 artifacts is ALSO a [Kor Outfitter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kor Outfitter) that will lead to bad combat situations for opponents.  
  
If this is comes out with a loose [Sword of Feast and Famine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of Feast and Famine), a [memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=memnite), & an [ornithopter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ornithopter), op... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
He'll be great in my Glint Hawk deck. It has way more equipment than the usual cawblade deck.

Nim Deathmantle & Livewire Lash should both be fantastic with this guy. Especially if you don't want to sink 100+ dollars into swords.

Great standard impact or not, this guy will dominate kitchen tables for many many years to come.

UPDATE:

So the ruling on this guy ETB with Metalcraft on. Since you have priority, you can call the equip 0 as soon as he ETB before, and an opponent can respond with a Doom Blade. However since you called the equip 0, it still resolves despite Puresteel or his metalcraft no longer existing.

Meaning that this guy dropping in with 3 artifacts is ALSO a Kor Outfitter that will lead to bad combat situations for opponents.

If this is comes out with a loose Sword of Feast and Famine, a memnite, & an ornithopter, op... (see all)

Posted By: SeiberTross (5/9/2011 8:47:16 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Either of these abilities would've been good, but both makes him insanely powerful in a casual environment. If you don't have the removal to get rid of him quickly, your opponent will draw cards - and lots of them. With how many cheap, effective equipments there are in anything that isn't standard (there's still a few in standard), and also equipment fetching creatures like Stoneforge Mystic, he'll just keep drawing and drawing and drawing.  
  
In a non-standard environment throw in stuff like Leonin Shikari, and with the 0 equip cost blocking becomes a nightmare. Whichever creature you don't block will be given all the stuff to take off over half your health.  
  
A great card but so, so strong.
posts.html:
Either of these abilities would've been good, but both makes him insanely powerful in a casual environment. If you don't have the removal to get rid of him quickly, your opponent will draw cards - and lots of them. With how many cheap, effective equipments there are in anything that isn't standard (there's still a few in standard), and also equipment fetching creatures like Stoneforge Mystic, he'll just keep drawing and drawing and drawing.

In a non-standard environment throw in stuff like Leonin Shikari, and with the 0 equip cost blocking becomes a nightmare. Whichever creature you don't block will be given all the stuff to take off over half your health.

A great card but so, so strong.

Posted By: JaxsonBateman (5/11/2011 2:42:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Wow. All i have to say when I see this guy is "..really..?  
-On the curve  
-Repeated Card Advantage  
-OMG it just saved me blah amounts of mana  
  
Do keep in mind that Auriok Windstalker (despite that being instant speed) does essentially the same thing at 4 mana to a mere one equipment a turn. This guy does it to everything forever.  
  
That said, I do like that he's not an auto-include because of his specialty.

posts.post_content: [O-Naginata](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=O-Naginata), [Bonesplitter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bonesplitter), [Cranial Plating comes to mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cranial Plating comes to mind). Have this guy out with some of the cheapest power up equipments in your deck and you'll grow in power fast. Made a deck with them and the five sword of's. By the 7th turn i had only 20 cards in deck and a very high [Kor Duelist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kor Duelist) kicking butt.

posts.post_content:
Interesting;y enough, there are actually rules that state that a creature cannot equip itself to itself, just in case some degenerate game breaking combo existed that allowed something to do that, a la bludgeon brawl liquidmetal coating or march of the mahcines. it makes me sad :( I can't actually quote the rule though.   
  
The card can be just absolutely incredible though. having him drop, equipping him with a whole shit ton of swords and like the new swiftfoot boots or any other haste giver and your in business. I remember one person attempted to pull this on me and just wreck my board position but mana leak came to the rescue. A pretty solid card in the right deck if your capable enough to make it work without dosruption.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
This is one of those cards that, when looking at it before it's released, I've mixed opinion.
  
He's good - really friggin' good.
  
I am just unsure about where he'll fit in Standard, if at all.
  
I want him to be in Caw-Blade. Or any of the other equipment-oriented Standard decks.
  
But because I'm not completely in-the-know about how those decks work,
  
I'm just not sure if there's a spot for him.
  
5/5, because he's good no matter how you look at it.

posts.post_content:
Works with [Leonin Shikari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leonin Shikari) for the best equipment deck combo ever.  
  
Allows absurd mana accel, storm, and card draw capabilities with [Sunforger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sunforger) (using [Manamorphose](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Manamorphose) and [Pyretic Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyretic Ritual)/[Seething Song](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seething Song)).  
  
Is really good if you play even one equipment, but the metalcraft bonus is spectacular.
posts.html:
Works with Leonin Shikari for the best equipment deck combo ever.

Is really good if you play even one equipment, but the metalcraft bonus is spectacular.
